Jonathan Tennenbaum, The Crab Nebula and The ComplexDomain, Executive Intelligence Review, p.23

"Did the idea of universal entropy come from observations? Or from some other kind of real evidence? If we critically examine where certain ideas and ways of thinking actually come from in science, we often find that they did come from a process of discovery. The idea of universal entropy did not come from some scientific discovery. It was actually introduced from the outside, as an ideological perversion of science."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Discovery vs Ideology
